intro: Chaetogastra montana, commonly known as the mountain chaetogastra, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in local herbal remedies.
